description.narrative: Effective coordination for a timely humanitarian WASH response at national and sub-national levels, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs.

sector.narrative: Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective coordination for a timely humanitarian WASH response at national and sub-national levels, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs.

description.narrative: UNICEF in partnership with line ministry and humanitarian partners continued to build resilience of vulnerable people both in in-accessible and hard to reach (HTR) areas with durable solution. By the end June 2020, over 93,000 people in 27 districts of 10 provinces have gained access to safe and sustainable drinking water. through humanitarian WASH programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: People facing humanitarian situation accessing basic sanitation
Number of people in humanitarian situation reached with hygiene supplies and hygiene promotionmessages and have access to means of hygiene (family hygiene kit)
People facing humanitarian situation accessing safe drinking water through durable and temporary solution
Number of public institutions (schools and health facilities) in humanitarian situation accessing safe drinking water and sanitation services through temporary and durable solutions
Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene
